intro: Pteromonnina rugosa, commonly known as the rough pteromonnina, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
